question: You are on a muddy tee box and struggling to find a spot where you don't slip. According to the rules of golf, how much of the tee box are you allowed to use to tee up your ball?*

choices.text: Only the dry part of the tee box
Anywhere on the tee box as long as it's no closer to the hole than the tee markers.
Within one club-lengths behind the tee markers.
Within two club-lengths behind the tee markers.

explanation: The rules of golf allow a player to tee up the ball anywhere between the tee markers and up to two club-lengths behind the line formed by the markers. The condition of the ground within these limits does not affect where you can place your tee
